issue.title: [PDTS] Unclear semantics of read_symlink on error

discussion.p: Unclear semantics of read_symlink on error: 15.27 [fs.op.read_symlink] has: Returns: If p resolves to a symbolic link, a path object containing the contents of that symbolic link. Otherwise path(). and also [Note: It is an error if p does not resolve to a symbolic link. -- end note]
I do not believe path() can be a valid return for the overload not taking error_code.

blockquote.p: Returns: If p resolves to a symbolic link, a path object containing the contents of that symbolic link. Otherwise path(). The signature with argument ec returns path() if an error occurs.
Throws: As specified in Error reporting. [Note: It is an error if p does not resolve to a symbolic link. -- end note]
